com.sun.tools.visualvm.tools.attach
Class AttachModel

java.lang.Object
  com.sun.tools.visualvm.core.model.Model
      com.sun.tools.visualvm.tools.attach.AttachModel

public abstract class AttachModel
extends Model

This class uses Attach API to obtatin various information from JVM. Note that Attach API is available in JDK 6 and up and only for local processes running as the same user. See Attach API documentaion for mode details.

Author:
Tomas Hurka

Method Detail

getSystemProperties

public abstract java.util.Properties getSystemProperties()
Returns the current system properties in the target Application.

This method returns the system properties in the target virtual machine. Properties whose key or value is not a String are omitted. The method is approximately equivalent to the invocation of the method System.getProperties in the target virtual machine except that properties with a key or value that is not a String are not included.

Returns:
The system properties of target Application
See Also:
System.getProperties()

takeHeapDump

public abstract boolean takeHeapDump(java.lang.String fileName)
Takes heap dump of target Application. The heap is written to the fileName file in the same format as the hprof heap dump.

Parameters:
fileName - String where heap dump will be stored.
Returns:
returns true if operation was successful.

takeThreadDump

public abstract java.lang.String takeThreadDump()
Takes thread dump of target Application.

Returns:
Returns String of the thread dump from target Application.

takeHeapHistogram

public abstract HeapHistogram takeHeapHistogram()
Takes heap histogram of target Application.

Returns:
Returns HeapHistogram of the heap from target Application.
Since:
VisualVM 1.2

printFlag

public abstract java.lang.String printFlag(java.lang.String name)
print VM option. Note that VM option is the one which starts with -XX:

Parameters:
name - name of VM option. For examle HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError
Returns:
Full text of VM option. For example -XX:+HeapDumpOnOutOfMemoryError

setFlag

public abstract void setFlag(java.lang.String name,
                             java.lang.String value)
Sets a VM option of the given name to the specified value.

Parameters:
name - Name of a VM option
value - New value of the VM option to be set
